subject: Brake pedal issue
description_text:
Hi all 

After having my plus x pedals for around four months I am now having issues with a very squeaky break pedal, 

I have tryed loosening the collar where the elastomers sit but no joy. 

I haven’t added any grease or oil as I didn’t want to cause any further damage to the pedal and not sure what product to use. 

Can you advise on how I can solve this issue please 

Thanks 

Matthew wright 
Sent from my iPhone

conversations.body_text: Hi matthew wroght,    Could you please provide us with a video? This will help us analyze the issue more effectively. In addition, at the end of the PlusX manual, there are instructions indicating that this area can be lubricated.

Hi

Thanks for the speedy response

Please see video attached. Apologies for the poor angle
Regards
Matthew wright

Sent from my iPhone
Hi matthew wroght,    I have forwarded your video to our production team for inspection. Once we receive a solution, I will get back to you promptly.
Hi matthew wroght,    Could you please take a clear photo of the black spring section of the brake pedal? I’d like to check whether any washers were not installed correctly.

Hi

Please see pictures as requested

Thanks
Matthew wright
[image0.jpeg][image1.jpeg][image2.jpeg]
Sent from my iPhone
Hi matthew wroght,    The spring’s flange washer should be installed on the steel plate side. Your current installation is incorrect — it may damage the washer and cause noise.

Ok so I need to flip the black plate holding the spring around 180 degrees?
Sent from my iPhone
Hi matthew wroght,    The washer located at the red-marked position.

Hi

Justin to confirm this is the correct installation?

If so then I am still experiencing squeeking from the pedal. I shall send a further video in seperate email

Thanks
Matthew wright

[image0.jpeg][image1.jpeg]
Sent from my iPhone

Hi matthew wroght,    Apply some lubricant to the plastic moving parts — once properly lubricated, there should be no noise.  Please remove the pedal from the bracket and place it on the floor, then press or step on it to check whether the sound is coming from the bracket.

Hi

After doing a lot more testing and remounting the pedals I have found the issue. Please see vid attached

I have applied ptfd spray multiple times and still can’t remove the squeak sound. There are no loose blots either.

Thanks
Matthew wright

Sent from my iPhone

Hi matthew wroght,  Please follow the picture and swap the positions of the thrust bearing and the black nylon washer, then test again. Also, please provide your order number, contact name, phone number, and address, and we’ll send you a new set of bearings for replacement.
